Erik

name: Tapcade

location_machine_xrefs.condition: Pin was down 3/30/19

machine_conditions.comment: Pin was down 3/30/19

This pin is a blast! The transparent ramps are great and the playfield overall is super fun. FYI, this is a older machine and I did notice a two technical issues that need servicing. The biggest issue is some of the active drop in bumpers are not working at all, which affects scoring and playability (nothing serious but something that would be straight forward to service). Also, on drop in, the ball tends to fall in the far left inlane which probably means the playfield needs to be leveled a bit. Again, this is a older pin but if they had this machine serviced it would really shine. Definitely worth some quarters, check it out!

location_machine_xrefs.condition: I think it is good working order now.

name: Up-Down KC
description:
The good: Thursday is ten tokens for a dollar day. All pins cost only one token/quarter!
The bad: Large crowds when they're busy. No replays. Most outlanes are on their widest settings. They've added weight to their lighter machines.

Not a fan. There's so much frenetic video display stuff going on in this design that it distracts from the things that make other, more mechanical, pinball titles much more fun. This is more of a video game hybrid than a pinball machine which is fine if that's your jam. Otherwise, for those who prefer more traditional/mechanical pinball, Star Wars Pro is a bit of an eye sore.

location_machine_xrefs.condition: New (*replaced their Metallica)

location_machine_xrefs.condition: This is Up/Downs best pin. Lots of fun, fast pace, games last reasonably long if you stick with it. A little beat up but game seems to work fine. Only downside is the environment is crazy hot (need some fans up there, big time) plus the room does not exactly smell pleasant :(

machine_conditions.comment: This is Up/Downs best pin. Lots of fun, fast pace, games last reasonably long if you stick with it. A little beat up but game seems to work fine.
